name: Copthorne Hotel Wellington Oriental Bay

reviews.title: Great Location, Quiet Retreat
reviews.text: Stayed two nights at this gem and enjoyed it immensely. The location is perfect for a Wellington visit - easy to walk all attractions and on a less-congested section of the harbor front. The hotel is well-appointed, comfortable and attractive. We stayed in the front section and had a fantastic balcony view of the harbor - a bit of traffic noise, but not bothersome. The room was a generous size, with tasteful dark wood decor and a large bathroom. The staff was super helpful with tips and directions. I really enjoyed morning walks, turning right out the font door and strolling the harbor front towards Mount Victoria. Also, this hotel has the fastest elevator I've ever experienced - a nice perk when you're tired after a day of much walking.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay in Wellington at the Copthorne. The staff were all outstanding and the front desk/concierage did everything they could to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. The International Sevens Rugby festival certainly made for an exciting time in Weliington. Our room, on Oriental Bay, was perfect in every respect. The buffet breakfast was very good. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many restaurants and bars.

reviews.title: Location, Location
reviews.text: We stayed one night to visit the city and the Te Papa Mueseum particularly. Its a great location and you can walk everywhere, its very near the world class museum.

reviews.title: The Best Position in Wellington
reviews.text: We booked a room with sea views and enjoyed looking at the commercial harbour and leisure craft. Very comfortable room with luxurious fittings. Excellent overall. Parking was pricey but actually the norm for city hotels in New Zealnd now, I believe.

reviews.title: Good hotel, lovely location
reviews.text: Short drive to the Interislander Ferry Teminal. Helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the better hotels we have stayed in. Unbeatable views from our room's 9th floor balcony overlooking the yacht club; easy 10 minute walk to the CBD and restaurants. Helpful staff. Free wifi in the lobby areas was a big plus in comparison to other hotels.
reviews.title: Superb Views of Wellington Harbour

reviews.text: Stayed at Copthorne Oriental Bay with the family and it is a highly recommended hotel to stay at - easy access to restaurants, walking distance to Te Papa Museum etc. The rooms were clean, checking in was a breeze and a request for a late check out was not a problem. The Reception staff were great, the food and beverage team was efficient - good room service menu and the concierge desk was also helpful. Last but not least, the Housekeeping team also did a fabulous job!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel and what an investment it was. Great service, great location and lovely bedroom. A must have if you would like to enjoy the beautiful scenery of Wellington and the beach. I will definitely be coming back here again A++++ Accommodation.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Cheers Copthorne for the stay, money well spent =)
reviews.title: Family two night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we had two children we were looking for a hotel that would have separate sleeping areas without having o purchase interconnecting rooms. This property did not disappoint. We got the Kid n All package booked directly to friendly responsive Receptionist.We were on the second floor looking out onto harbour. Fully functional bathroom separated a King size bed and twin beds which was perfect . Room was perfect had everything we needed and was quiet which is a big thing for me. Pool was perfect for children as the weather was insanely hot, a tad tired could do with some more seating for adults and a paint but otherwise children did not care and was very refreshing and good depth for children (6 & 7) and adults. As part of package children ate free so had a fabulous buffet breakfast both mornings. Did not have a evening meal there. The children got free mocktails and have to say their Mojito was one of the best i have had. Fabulous location Oriental parade on your door step with a quick easy stroll to Te papa and Courtney place really lovely walk along waterfront to Lambton quay / shops & bars. All staff we tentative, engaging & friendly nothing a problem. Would go back in a heart beat when we next return to Wellington.

description: Where location is everything! A $10 million refurbishment and its prime waterfront position overlooking one of the world'€™s most beautiful harbors makes the Copthorne Hotel Wellington Oriental Bay one of the most luxurious accommodation experiences in Wellington. Contemporary decor, exceptional dining options, heated indoor swimming pool and state-of-the-art technology with all the convenient comforts you would expect from a modern city hotel such as broadband internet, modem points and a large wall-mounted LCD TV.
